description: On March 9th, Romania announced that all schools would be closed until March 22nd. On March 16, the Education Minister announced that schools would remain closed until after Easter Break (which ends on April 21).
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)

description: Between 6:00-22:00, Romania recommended that individuals do not leave their residence apart from work, the purchase of basic goods, medical assistance or to walk their pet.
Romania barred the movement of any individuals between 10pm and 6am, unless they can furnish an affidavit which provides a professional or personal reason for being outside.

Romania imposed a curfew on all over 65 year olds, who are only allowed to leave home between 11:00am and 1:00pm for medical treatment or between 8:00pm and 9:00pm to walk their pets, or for professional activities.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Romania banned the movement of persons aged 65 and above, outside the house and household except travel for professional or agricultural purposes and medical assistance. In windows between 7:00am and 11:00am and 7:00pm and 10:00pm, movement was also allowed for the purchase of basic needs, short travel for the needs of pets, for accompanying children, the elderly, the ill or persons with disabilities.
On 27 April, the tenth Military Ordinance came into effect. Except for work and medical emergency, people over 65 were only allowed to leave their homes between 7 a.m.-11 a.m. and 7 p.m-10 p.m.
Romania changed the qualitative nature of a curfew imposed on persons aged 65 and above.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Romania declared a state of emergency on March 16th.
Romania's President announced an extension to the state of emergency, that has been in place since March 16th.

On 14 May 2020, the National Committee for Emergency Situation issued Decision no. 24 approving the state of alert on national level, as well as specific measures for controlling and preventing the spread of COVID-19.
Romania suspended all flights from and to Italy.

Romania asked all local authorities to place disinfectant solutions in all housing societies and to disinfect elevators, stairwells and other common areas.

Romania empowered the Center for Medical-Military Scientific
Research, the Center for CBRN (Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Scientific), Scientific Research for Defense and Ecology, the Agency for  Research of Military Technique and Technologies and the National Institute for Medical-Military Research and Development "Cantacuzino" to   to approve/authorize medical materials, components, equipment and devices necessary for the prevention and control of the spread, as well as for the treatment of the infection with the SARS-CoV-2 virus, and also
biocides.

public authorities institutions and all public and private operatorsare obliged to organise their activitys o as allow for work to be performed from home; where the activity cannot be carried out in a work from home structure, entities must implement measures to ensure:epidemiologic triage through temperature control for own personnel and visitors; disinfection of hands before entering workspaces;
observance of rules related to conduct of work in open spaces.

description: Romania banned all gatherings with 1,000 or more people.
Romania forbade the organization of any event involving more than 100 persons, in open spaces.
Romania banned all gatherings of more than 3 people not living together.

public meetings, concerts or other meetings in open spaces, as well as all cultural, scientific, artistic, sport, entertainment, gambling, fitness, swimming etc performed in closed spaces continue to be prohibited (except for certain activities, including: religious gatherings, personal care treatments in dedicated areas, training for professional athletes, certain cultural activities and recreational/sports activities such as cycling, hiking, running, swimming, mountain climbing, hunting, fishing and similar  the latter with the participation of not more than 3 individuals who do not live together)
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: Romania obliged any organizers of events with less than 100 people to ensure that a distance of at least 1 meter was maintained between participants.
